column5: Finally got out after some crappie. Was a nice morning without wind or rain. 4 hours was all I could take in the cast.  Have to admit I love catching fish with my own jigs and floats.
Nice looking crappie. That's a slab down here.
Well done Bruce!!!  I'm hoping to find some open water up this way on the weekend.
With the wind here if I decided to go fishing they would find me in NY. Nice fish Bruuuuuuce,
Nice feed.  Wish I had a local crappie spot.
You make floats now Bruce ?  Look at that  smile .
With the Grand in your backyard???
For a few years now. Simple balsa or cork
Well ok...ive just been lazy and haven't really looked for em I guess. What areas of a river do they prefer?
Nice one! I wish we had crappie of that size over here.
At this timeof year look for the mouth of feeder creeks.
Past week has been great for slab crappie and perch.  And its quality time I am spending with my daughter that is the best part.

Spent Saturday morning with the grandaughters. Got enough for a decent feed tween the 4 of us. We'll be doing a lot of fishing over the next 6 weeks as we registered into a 6 week multi species tournament with CFN.  DeeDee even got herself a 26"  carp

Great going Bruce!!!! My granddaughter is still way to young to come out with me yet; but I'll live the idea of via your posts; please keep your reports coming. On a side note. When your in London, I've got a box of wheel weights for you. Not a lot yet but the box is approx 12"X 4"X 3" (LWH) and its all but full. Dan.
Guess I'll have to make a point of stopping by enroute to Windsor or Chatham.  Don't worry Dan, you'll be fishing with the wee one sooner than you think.
